repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Diversified Farm Income
            and Market Development Project for Philippines were as
            follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was high, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: National
            Program Support (NPS) projects, which employ a Sector
            Investment and Maintenance (SIM) loan instrument, are used
            to implement sector and Public Expenditure Management (PEM)
            reforms in the Philippines. As an instrument for difficult
            institutional reforms, the Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project (DFIMDP) experience shows that a
            National Program Support (NPS) would be appropriate and
            effective only when the client agency, especially its
            management, is fully committed and operationally prepared to
            implement and mainstream these reforms during the project
            period. This is especially true for Philippines which have
            shown a systemic dichotomy between policy and operations,
            especially in the agriculture and fisheries sector. Without
            strong evidence that reforms are indeed already firmly
            implemented on the ground level, the Bank should consider
            very carefully before becoming fully engaged in a reform
            program with a client agency. The Bank is better positioned
            to facilitate, rather than lead or catalyze, reforms, at
            least within the current political economy of the
            Philippines. The World Bank (WB), therefore, should be
            reluctant to fully enter the reform picture in the country
            until these reforms are already well entrenched among the
            clients, especially among the government managers.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Diversified Farm Income and Market
            Development Project will assist the Government in
            strengthening the Department of Agriculture's (DA)
            capacity for the provision of market-oriented services, thus
            increase agricultural competitiveness, and rural incomes.
            Given the deeply entrenched nature of many areas requiring
            reform, this process of institutional, and attitudinal
            change will take time, and sustained efforts to achieve.
            Components will support market development services, and
            collaboration in market promotion, trade fairs, etc., with
            the private sector. Further support shall strengthen the
            core functions of the DA and Government agencies concerning
            agricultural statistics, information technology for
            agriculture and fisheries, and agricultural training.
            Initially, it would be implemented in the four Focus Areas
            supported by the project, complemented with community-based
            information dissemination systems available to various types
            of farmers/growers and the general community. Market
            development investments will focus on rural roads, and other
            rural infrastructure, strengthened through an appropriate
            selection, approval and implementation criteria and
            procedures, to ensure demand-driven, market-oriented
            investments, supported, primarily through local government
            units (LGUs) and producer groups. The safety and quality
            assurance systems for market development will be achieved by
            strengthening the implementation capacity of the DA's
            regulatory services, as well as institutional strengthening,
            and, coordinating with other regulatory agencies to complete
            a review and action plan, aimed at rationalizing the
            technical, physical and financial needs for the
            strengthening, operation and maintenance of laboratories
            needed to service the DA's overall regulatory system.
            Furthermore, seeds and horticultural planting material will
            be supported through the expansion of scion groves to
            propagate vegetal species, while training and facilitation
            should significantly expand accredited private sector,
            operated seed farms, and nurseries. Market-linked technology
            development and dissemination is designed to leverage a
            change, by modifying and strengthening implementation of the
            DA's competitive research grants scheme, and, through
            partner-LGUs, information training provision will be
            available also to farmers not affiliated to organized
            growers/farmers groups. Such participation to, and adoption
            of training shall enable the DA in assessing the extent of
            training reach, and success. Technical assistance will be
            provided to help implement Intellectual Property Rights
            provisions, to promote better dissemination of technology,
            and greater private sector involvement, as certification of
            improved seed and vegetative products evolve. Finally,
            improvement of public expenditure management will focus on
            public resource allocation, and utilization, which includes
            better linkages between planning and budgeting.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will ensure that the
            strategy for addressing the issues pertaining to the
            indigenous peoples must be based on "informed
            participation" of the indigenous peoples themselves.
            The barangay or municipal tribal council where quantified
            (based on eligibility criteria for subprojects) will be the
            preferred applicant and/or subproject proponent. If the
            applicant is not the tribal council for the affected
            indigenous people, the applicant by itself or assisted by
            the sponsoring agency will ensure that the tribal councils
            affected by any subproject are properly consulted.
            Recognizing that the indigenous peoples have their customs
            and traditions, such consultations should be carried out
            according to their customs and traditions. In addition to
            the applicant and/or the sponsoring agency and the
            indigenous peoples affected, the National Commission on
            Indigenous Peoples through its representatives should be
            present in these meetings. The meetings with the members of
            the tribe conducted for this purpose will be properly
            documented. It will include: Design of the project; intended
            beneficiaries and their roles; In case of land/assets,
            acquisition, names of affected persons and details about the
            proposed nature and level of compensation to the tribe and
            to the families that are directly affected; how these
            arrangements can be documented; list of complaints (if any);
            maps or other instruments that the IPs can understand
            (showing affected areas and replacement areas) will be attached.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The goal of the project is to stimulate
            rural growth and farmer incomes by enhancing competitiveness
            of Philippine agriculture and fisheries commodities and
            market-oriented private sector-led investments. An inventory
            for each road, bridge, irrigation canal, water supply pipe
            alignment or segment thereof by the representative of
            Municipal LGU and other municipal agencies concerned with
            resettlement and assisted by the Provincial Government. This
            will be approved by the Review Committee (RC) of the
            Department of Agriculture-Regional Field Unit (DA-RFU) for
            any sub-project, and submitted to the World Bank (Manila
            Office) for its concurrence. In case where the potential
            adverse impact of a sub-project on project affected persons
            PAPs is major a full resettlement plan for each such road or
            segment or road or irrigation system or any sub-project will
            be prepared by the LGU and assisted by the National Housing
            Authority (NHA) in accordance with the provisions of this
            resettlement policy. The full resettlement plan will include
            among others: a completed inventory; detailed compensation
            and entitlement calculations for each affected household,
            where applicable; a detailed socioeconomic survey of PAPs
            describing their age, sex, ethnicity, education, main
            occupation, sources of income per year; location, area and
            category of the replacement residential and agricultural
            land to be provided, if that be the case; a time-bound
            action plan for implementation; and arrangements for
            external monitoring and evaluation.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Philippines Diversified Farm Income and Market
            Development Project, which stimulates rural growth and
            farmer incomes by enhancing competitiveness of Philippine
            agriculture and fisheries commodities and market-oriented
            private sector-led investments. This report discusses
            expected negative environmental impacts and measures to
            mitigate them. During construction, likely impacts are
            surface runoff, soil erosion, and siltation and
            sedimentation of nearby water bodies. To offset them,
            provide slope and road cut protection; construct a road
            drainage system; install riprapping (stone foundation),
            wattling (a fabrication of interwoven poles), and fascines
            (bound wood sticks) to shore up embankments; plant
            vegetation (shrubs, bushes, and selected trees), especially
            along road shoulders; properly manage the site; dispose of
            solid wastes and earth spoils; construct sediment sediment
            traps to prevent drainage canal clogging; and regularly
            sprinkle water to control dust. In addition during the
            project's implementation phase, remove rubbish to dump
            sites; compact topsoil; haul, spread, and compact filling
            materials from earth cuts and borrow pits; divert rainwater
            through canals; provide traffic warning signs, barricades,
            and flagmen and schedule construction delivery and waste
            material transport during off-peak hours to control traffic;
            install silencers on exhaust mufflers and maintain machinery
            properly to reduce noise; restrict work operations, reduce
            speeds, use signage, and inform community to prevent
            vehicular accidents; and require workers to strictly observe
            safety standards.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Diversified Farm
            Income and Market Development Project : environmental
            assessment : Executive summary

Philippines - Diversified Farm Income and
            Market Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Philippines Diversified Farm Income and Market
            Development Project, which stimulates rural growth and
            farmer incomes by enhancing competitiveness of Philippine

            mitigate them. During construction, likely impacts are
            surface runoff, soil erosion, and siltation and

            traps to prevent drainage canal clogging; and regularly
            sprinkle water to control dust. In addition during the
            project's implementation phase, remove rubbish to dump
            sites; compact topsoil; haul, spread, and compact filling
            materials from earth cuts and borrow pits; divert rainwater
            through canals; provide traffic warning signs, barricades,
            and flagmen and schedule construction delivery and waste
            material transport during off-peak hours to control traffic;
            install silencers on exhaust mufflers and maintain machinery
            properly to reduce noise; restrict work operations, reduce
            speeds, use signage, and inform community to prevent
            vehicular accidents; and require workers to strictly observe
            safety standards.
